is a small city in Mercer County located in the

Harrodsburg, the first permanent English settlement west of the Allegheny Mountains, was the site of a fort built by James Harrod in 1775. 

In 1806, Shaker Village of Pleasant Hill, or Shakertown was founded in Harrodsburg when forty-four converts to the Shaker religion signed a covenant agreeing to mutual support and the common ownership of property.
You'll almost certainly get to Harrodsburg by car.

value: Shaker Village of Pleasant Hill is America's largest restored Shaker community, with 34 restored buildings and 3,000 acres of preserved farmland.
address=Leaves from Shaker Landing, 3501 Lexington Rd
hours=Daily Apr 28-Oct 28. Departures at 2PM and 4PM, arrive at Shaker Landing thirty minutes prior to departure
price=$10 (13 & above), $5 (6-12), free for children 5 & under

content=The 115-passenger riverboat located at Shaker Village cruises the scenic Kentucky River palisades. An one hour narrated cruise passes by the oldest exposed rock in Kentucky, and goes under High Bridge built in 1877. The riverboat is accessible to persons with physical disabilities.
Fort Harrod, reconstruction of first permanent settlement in Kentucky.

content=Herrrington Lake was formed in 1925 by the damming of the Dix River to create hydroelectric power for Kentucky Utilities.  Herrington Lake is the deepest lake in Kentucky with a maximum depth of 249 feet and 325 miles of shoreline.
price=Apr 1-Oct 31: adults $5, children $3; Nov 1-Mar 31: adults $3, children $1
. The park has a full-scale replica of the fort built by James Harrod in 1774. The  complex also features the Lincoln Marriage Temple and oldest cemetery west of the Allegheny mountains.

content=A "bar and grill" restaurant at the Beaumont Inn named for the Kentucky Owl Bourbon Whiskey distilled in the area prior to Prohibition.
